result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard J Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges (including the Domestic Abuse Assessment) during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment; Provide DNA sample. Court WAIVED DNA surcharge due to the length of time between this case and the defendant's last conviction. Per Court, cash bail on deposit to apply towards costs, fees and surcharges.

Commit no new crimes rising to the level of probable cause.
Defendant may continue having contact with minor children.
No violent contact with the victim Darlene J.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard J Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard J Johnson in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

As to COUNT 1-
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 be dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Richard J Johnson in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
BRANCH 25 FOR BRANCH 40. Case set for final pretrial. Defense counsel does not object to Branch 25 hearing this matter. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Court finds the State has complied with the victim rights legislation. State placed negotiations on the record.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 2-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Elements of the Offense sheet received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
Case set for final pretrial.  Defendant would like to enter a plea.  Court is in trial.  Branch 25 agreed to take the case.  Matter sent there forthwith.   rmm

Defendant Richard J Johnson in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Defense motion to modify the no contact order heard.  Court ordered Jazmine G.-J. removed from the no contact order.  No contact remains with Darlene J.  Final pretrial remains set for 7/21/15.
for Review and Modification of Bail received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  rmm

Defendant Richard J Johnson in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
$400.00 bail to be returned.  No Weapons Order, signed and filed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-25-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Darlene J. and Jazmine G.J. or their residence or place of employment

Defendant Richard J Johnson in court.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.40  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/10/15 @ 1:30pm
